website_summaries.verdict: The Anker USB data hub to choose when you want the highest number of data ports.
pros: 13 dedicated data ports are capable of fast transfer speeds and device recharging
Aluminum construction makes the device great and durable for travel uses
cons: Certain ports can unexpectedly stop working after some use, requiring repair or replacement

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as promised! With a 14-port USB hub ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work as promised! With a 14-port USB hub, you'd think that you could hook up a few devices (only 6) . . . but, you'd be wrong! Trying to hub a printer, a USB cable for charging a phone, and 2 to 4 Solid State external drives . . . only the printer and cable worked . . . no connection with SSDs. To make matters worse, Sally (CS Support MANAGER) offered me a measly 20% refund and told me that my "normal" devices were exceeded the hub's capacity . . . ridiculous! I solved the issue by returning the hub to Amazon for a FULL refund, then ordering a competing hub, which works flawlessly with the same devices.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Laidlaw

customer_reviews.title: 2 years in service before issue with ports
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in May 2014 and unfortunately have 4 dead ports (closest to the power port) as of August 2016. The other ports including the power port continue to work as expected, so not a total loss. I mention my experience for awareness yet it does not mean your experience will be the same should you buy one. I still believe it is one of the nicest hubs I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: SBSneetch

customer_reviews.title: Hub stopped working after just a few months but Anker Customer Service quickly replaced it...
customer_reviews.text: I had originally rated this item poorly, having purchased it on July 8, 2017 and enduring a product failure about two months later. The hub has been treated gently, on my office desk the whole time. However, Anker Customer Service is superb: they quickly sent me a replacement, and it's worked well. I will provide any updates if/as needed.
customer_reviews.author: JCT

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead in 3.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in Oct 2014 and it has worked without issue since then. It is connected to an iMac - 2009 vintage. The Mac is still kicking but the hub just died, all ports stopped showing blue LEDs. They are able to provide charge to my iPhone but not able to communicate via USB. I've rebooted, disconnected all devices, turned off, removed power supply and reassembled from start, one USB cable at a time. None of the blue USB connected LEDs came on. I would expect more than 3 years and 7 months of service from a non-wear product like this. It was great while it lasted though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hackney

customer_reviews.title: This device failed to work properly since I received it.  Several attempts to get Anker to resolve have been unfruitful.
customer_reviews.text: This device failed to work properly since I received it. Several attempts to get Anker to resolve have been unfruitful. I was a die hard Anker Fan that recommended their products to many people. Well, you can imagine how I feel about the company now. It would take a lot to make up for this.... :/
customer_reviews.author: OurWorldMallDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Faulty ports and unreliable charging.
customer_reviews.text: Faulty ports as received.The ports work intermittently, requires frequent unplugging and re-plugging to reactive the ports. None of the function lights worked out of the box. Charging is also unreliable. The device has started to hum, buzz, beep intermittently, and heat up then losing connections. Looks like it might burst into flames one day. All ports stopped showing blue LEDs. No electrical charge to usb outlets. Not consistent port. Waste of money and space. Unusable poor quality product and useless service.
customer_reviews.author: Confidential

customer_reviews.title: Not working with my Macs
customer_reviews.text: Just received this, and I can't get it to work with any of my 3 macs. Powers on (the green light is lit), but I can't get any device to work with it. I can't even get a simple USB keyboard or mouse to respond. I've have pretty good luck with Anker stuff in the past, but I think I'm going to turn this. Very Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mr. t

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Anker 13 port powered USB 3.0 hub without realizing that I was going to instantly fill every port with something. Using 6 external hard drives (each has its own wall wart, should not be using USB power) at once, it seems to do OK. I haven't done serious throughput testing to see if I can make it become unstable, but so far stability hasn't been an issue. Transfer speeds from external to internal drives is good enough that I haven't felt the need to investigate further. Strong aluminum case, not too large, external power supply. Maybe use a power connector that's harder to accidentally pull out than a coaxial plug.
customer_reviews.author: John Shalamskas

customer_reviews.title: They ended up replacing the defective unit i got first.  Excellent customer service for their product.
customer_reviews.text: This worked for a few months and then bam! stopped working.. I tried everything... i'm a pretty techie dude...believe me when i said I've tried everything. .. sad part is there are no available drivers to reinstall once you clean up everything related to this product. The anker website is useless. .no drivers there either. Contact their main contact and no one response. I would not recommend this product for the price. The actual price for this is like $5.99 . Wouldn't pay anything more than that. Good luck. ------------------------------------------------------- Their customer service is excellent. They ended up replacing the defective unit. Thank you so much for that. I am back in business now.
customer_reviews.author: zlvdx

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after ONLY 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: When we first got the hub, it worked great. It was easy to set up and use. However, just 2 months later, we started having problems with certain ports not working. By the end of 3 months, it crapped out all together! Then, when we tried to use the Warranty to replace it, they canceled the warranty!!! What a rip-off.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty flaky
customer_reviews.text: I use a USB hub to connect peripherals to my laptop so I can use it like a desktop at home and run everything off a single USB connection for convenience. My previous hub was full so I bought this for more ports, but it's fairly unreliable. It has trouble picking up my mouse unless I unplug/plug it several times, and none of my USB flash drives work on it although they work just fine on other hubs. All ports seem to work, it's like specific devices are difficult for the hub to communicate with.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Mott

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power for multiple larger usb drives
customer_reviews.text: I had an Amazon Basics 10 port hub which worked great - until I plugged in four to 6 3 TB usb drives. I would find the drives disconnected or having to pull and re-plug the power connector to get the drives to come up and believe they have enough power. Those newer, denser, heavier drives were just beyond what the power supply could deliver. So - this one. This runs 4 3 TB drives, printer, scanners, iPhone charger, dvd drive, and I have four spots left. No hiccups, metal case, solid feel.
customer_reviews.author: spence.munsinger

customer_reviews.title: Emits high-pitched whine.
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I plugged this hub in, it started emitting a high-pitched whine at the edge of hearing. It is thus uncomfortable to sit at my desk when this hub is powered on. Instantly returned it, because I don't like feeling like I have tinnitus. I hope this problem is a once-off problem with the unit I received, rather than a problem with the entire model.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bristol

customer_reviews.title: I finally found a perfect USB 3.0 hub. My hub problems are over!
customer_reviews.text: Previously, I bought two different powered USB 3.0 hubs. In both, each port had its own on-off switch. It was so frustrating that the ports were not always reliably on. Sooooo frustrating. Then I tried 4 other hubs, and they worked, sometimes. As long as I rebooted, I could get my mouse to work. Not ideal, huh? I had given up find a way to connect 8 devices. I tried piggy backing them and . . . they often disconnected themselves. Now I own perfection. Everything works correctly all the time. Oh what a relief it is!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: Causes interference with Apple Wireless Mouse & Trackpad
customer_reviews.text: I already own an Anker 7-port USB hub and it has worked great. However, due to additional USB devices, I needed additional ports so I went and purchased this 13 port hub. As soon as I turned it on, my wireless mouse became sluggish and unresponsive. I tried my Apple Wireless Trackpad and the same issue. As soon as I turned off hub, both devices worked normally. I tired changing ports where the cable plugged directly into the computer, but that did not work. It looks like I will need to return and find something else. Bummer and I really liked the size and build quality of this hub.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sz

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made, too weak
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, but all those ports don't help very much because it can't supply very much power. And if you exceed the power rating (by plugging in two USB hard drives) the whole device locks up and has to be reset by removing the power. (This takes everything connected to it offline.) I wanted to love it, but now consider it unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this hub five stars. Then, when several of the ports stopped working after a few months, I dropped my rating down to one star. Then customer service contacted me to make things right for me ... that's right, THEY contacted ME ... pretty amazing for an online vendor. They sent me another hub at no charge to me to replace the defective one ... again, pretty amazing for an online vendor. Everything seems to be working fine.
customer_reviews.author: JST

customer_reviews.title: Defective at delivery. Depress start button. No electrical ...
customer_reviews.text: Defective at delivery. Depress start button. No electrical charge to usb outlets part from firm pressure on "Anker" logo. Second time I've had difficulty with a recent Anker purchase. The product line was once known for reliability. Now all downhill. Returning for credit.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Well It Worked For 2 Years!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to complain about a USB hub that works reliably for over 2 years, I guess. Yet I'm still disappointed it died, considering its price. It sat on my desk the whole time, and I plugged stuff into it repeatedly, so it certainly got a lot of use. And most of the ports were in use at any one time. I know it's not the AC adapter that failed because I was able to use the same AC adapter to power a different hub I had laying around. Time to shop for a new hub!
customer_reviews.author: Frankie G

customer_reviews.title: Typical Anker product — terrific!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Anker products and this one is no exception. I connect all of my USB devices to this hub and then use a USB C to USB adapter to connect it to my MacBook Pro. I've had great customer service from Anker in the past and have always been impressed with the quality of their products. I expect to get years of service from this hub.
customer_reviews.author: R. HurleyTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: after a year this device suddenly stopped working. It was flaky before that, occasionally losing connections.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You really can't get any better than this for a USB 3.0 port hub from Anker!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice powered USB 3.0 port hub! I have 7 devices plugged in without any slow downs when using 3.0 speeds! Solid construction, lights on the ports that are active is nice so you know the activity of the port. The extra is the dedicated charger ports so I can charge my cell phone with PC detecting it so the speed of charging activates the rapid charge feature on my LG V30! Anker is top notch and will buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Charles BridgTec

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: We have numerous Anker products. We thought we had finally found a good company. Then we got this device. The power cable will not insert into the device far enough to power it. We tried an Anker brick known to be good, but it would not insert. We took this brick and inserted it into another Anker product, worked fine. The hub is defective.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Went from great to garbage in about 16 months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this hub for the first year or so, but as time passed several of the ports began to work only intermittently. I had to power the hub off/on or unplug/replug USB cables to restore function. Now, six ports have failed completely. Disappointing for an $80 component that seemed so well put together. My experience with Anker products has been quite good over the years, but I can't recommend this hub.
customer_reviews.author: JS Writer

customer_reviews.title: Failed hub replaced by Anker after ~2 years. Another customer service win!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased August 2015. It worked perfectly until it died January 2017, when it stopped communicating with my PC. The hub was out of warranty, so I didn't contact Anker. After leaving a review, I was contacted by their customer support and offered a replacement at no charge. Another notch in Anker's belt for customer service. They'll continue to get my business in the future. Their products are well built, and if they do have a problem, the company stands behind their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Broke in under a week.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a week and it just stopped working. I power it off every night when I shutdown and today it stopped working. I've left it unplugged in hopes it resets but it did nothing. The led is green and no longer connects any of my peripherals to my desktop. Total piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Lovie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hub, High Power, Great Service
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I especially appreciate the large power capability that allows use of many bus-powered drives simultaneously. Rapid customer response when I thought one of the channels was malfunctioning. They sent a brand new unit to replace mine. Occasionally (~ every 3 months) a port will spontaneously disconnect during Windows 7 sleep mode. After much testing, I am now convinced this a Windows "feature" and not any inherent problem with the Anker hub. I would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Howe

customer_reviews.title: This worked perfect. Aluminum feels good and could handed sustained (like ...
customer_reviews.text: Just did a video shoot and needed to hook up 8 drives and 5 ssd card readers. This worked perfect. Aluminum feels good and could handed sustained (like 12 hours) 300-400 MB/s copies. Over the 5 days I backed up 74TB of raw video all through this.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Ripley

customer_reviews.title: First one died after 24 months and Anker replaced it.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this USB hub for the 24 months it worked. It had no trouble keeping iPads charged, running weird non-data peripherals (desk fan), and the various gamepads and tablets I left connected to test the games I develop on. When it conked out, I reached out to Anker and they refused to replace it because I was out of warranty. That's not unreasonable, but I expect more than 2 years of use out of a peripheral this expensive. UPDATE: Anker offered me a replacement after I wrote the above review. I'm happy to have a USB hub again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bair

customer_reviews.title: Review after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this product for 4 years now. It worked great out f the box and during the 1st year. The issue I first started having was that I would plug in a USB device like an external HDD and the device would not be recognized. This issue continued to get worse as time went along. During the last year, I finally realized that many of the USB connections on the hub actually stopped working. Recently I noticed that it is really putting off a lot of heat. I pulled my iLok from the unit and it is very hot to the touch. I'm now afraid to plug anything back into it so I'm looking for a replacement now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Brock

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Dropping Off All External Hard Drives - Brand New Right Out of Box
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed. I purchased this item with high hopes. I am a photographer and I work on several external hard drives throughout my day. Only ONE out of eleven ports being used stays consistently connected. Boooooo!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: WORKED GREAT FOR 5 YEARS BUT PORTS ARE DYING NOW
customer_reviews.text: This unit has been good for 5 years to the day. Now ports are starting to die, furthest from power source. Built of strong metal.
customer_reviews.author: Chanfrancisco

customer_reviews.title: Tried countless others, and this one actually WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: My old USB 3.0 hub quit working, plunging me into despair and my computer peripherals into digital purgatory. I thought it'd just bricked, so I bought another of the same manufacturer. No dice. Then I went to a local store and came back with two MORE hubs. Nothing. I reinstalled OS 10.11.3,, thinking maybe there was something not loading correctly. ēada. Then, today, came the Anker hub. Success! Everything works properly and I can get back to work. I don't think the other vendors are necessarily putting out garbage, but that their firmware may be a notch below what works. At any rate, I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: just another video guy

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but SKREEEEEEEEEE
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice charger, well designed and works just as expected except that the high-speed port emits a high-pitched whine that is annoying enough that I don't use it. If the high-speed port is the most important thing for you, this might not be the best model. Other than that, it looks nice on my desk and charges all the things just fine.
customer_reviews.author: bink

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Stays cool and allows me to plug in ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Stays cool and allows me to plug in all my USB devices without reaching around to the PC. Update: Several years too late, however I am updating my reviews as I scroll through past purchases. Anker has been my go-to for several years, but its starting to change. Their chargers stop working after a while, their cables always break, and this USB hub has been no different. A few years ago ports started to cease working. I would have to troubleshoot which ports were still active. Eventually all ports died and I was left with an expensive paperweight. It was great while it worked, but it burnt out pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hartsell

customer_reviews.title: REVISED REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Initially I gave it one star, because you can't give zero stars. But Anker sent me a new unit. It's working better, but still not reliably. After trying a million things to figure out why, I'm just sick of it. My experience with this product has been bad, but I raise my review from one star to two because the company tried to make it right.
customer_reviews.author: david j baker

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast Data Transfer and Charging
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hub to use with my Apple MacBook Pro. It has 13 ports plus a charging port which I love. It charges my devices super fast. I have about half of the ports occupied and I have not had any issues with it at all. It transfers data very quickly. It has a built in surge protector. All my devices work simultaneously. Its small and does not take up much room. I have it Velcro'd on to the back of my Apple monitor out of site. It can also be turned off with a button.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2boyz

customer_reviews.title: Product worked fine for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine for 3 months. Then, in the middle of the night, the USB data transmission suddenly stopped. The strip still could be used to charge devices but the data wasn't going through. Returning it for a replacement. Anker set a replacement ASAP which is working fine so far. They did not even require that I return the old one. I'll report back in a year to see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: David Bleser

customer_reviews.title: Definately an issue with the hub as the drives are all working fine. Clearly not for professional use
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks it stopped allowing my drives to communicate with the computer. Definately an issue with the hub as the drives are all working fine. Clearly not for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: This is a top quality device.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device in 2019 and it was a godsend for me. A perfect solution to my USB Hub requirements. Truly a superior product. After a solid year of 24/7 heavy usage, a couple of the Hub's USB connections failed (most certainly a result of my constant changing of devices in a less than gentle manner). I called a true professional (Sylvia) at Anker and with no muss or fuss she replaced the product in under the time she had calculated for the replacement. What a pleasure dealing with Sylvia of Anker.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Hennessey, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I've not yet been disappointed with any Anker products I've purchased -- which is ...
customer_reviews.text: I've not yet been disappointed with any Anker products I've purchased -- which is why I usually check to see if Anker has what I am looking for before buying. I've reviewed other products I have bought from this company and everyone of those products are still working as advertised. This USB hub is no exception. It's well built, feels solid and works; in fact I ordered another one as soon as I put the first one through its paces. I'm starting to sound like a commercial but I do not own stock, have no friends working for the company and have no interest in it. Their stuff just works.
customer_reviews.author: Epsilon9

customer_reviews.title: A real good 3.0 powered USB hub, all metal case.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase. The first one was damaged, my fault. The USB input was destroyed by sideloading that broke out the jack. With this said I got 4 years of service out of it and it would still be in use if not damaged. One of my favorite things about it is it has a real on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Signalshifter

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine til ports got unstable
customer_reviews.text: I had this and worked fine until a bunch of ports died together. Restarting hub brought them back but a month or so later they would go dead again. Replaced with another Anker hub which went bad, but that’s a separate review. Other than port issues, had no other stability problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: marauder

customer_reviews.title: really good, but this makes heat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for replacing my 2 set of dc-powered usb 2.0 4port hub. after replace, no error, no issue, whole usb devices are well connected as before. but this hub itself getting hot. so I'm slightly worried about safety. especially this season, hot summer. beacuse I just turn this on all day long . anyone who want to buy this for 24/7 usage, you really need to know about heat.
customer_reviews.author: SJ LEE

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: This usb hub has worked great, no problems at all with anything disconnecting (previous usb hub disconnected constantly) so this was a great replacement, my only issue is that flash drives get a little hot when they are plugged in but it hasn't damaged anything (yet) so it's fine, I would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Juan F. Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Plug Me In (Addendum title: Big Price, Short Life)
customer_reviews.text: Totally like this. I run a writing, radio production, and TV production home studio with professional quality work broadcasting on NBC and FM. This USB does the trick and keeps my wires all in one place. It is durable, well built and I made the right choice when I bought it. Addendum: In March of 2015 when I bought this Anker USB hub I loved it and gave it five stars. It stopped working last month (January 2017). It no longer connected my external HDs to my iMac, it stopped charging my iPhone and iPad. It failed. Big price short life. I replaced it with another brand. Now I give it two stars.
customer_reviews.author: P. B. Panagore

customer_reviews.title: An...
customer_reviews.text: ...excellent product. I highly recommend this. I use it for my external hard drives. The price could be cheaper but over all it is a very well made product and so far since I purchased it about 2 months ago I haven't had any issues with it. I have no regrets purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Of True Yashar'el

customer_reviews.title: So many USB-plugs and a fine power supply to handle all the plugged in units
customer_reviews.text: I first saw an Anker USB-hub at work on a project monitoring a fabrication tool. I asked about it and was told by the vendor, who chose it, that the unit didn't suffer by being underpowered like most of the USB-hubs available. When I got around to replacing my USB-hubs on my home computer, the single unit replaced all. The great thing is that the old hubs would be dropping peripherals and I would have to unplug and replug them to get the computer to recognize them again but the Anker hub has never had a peripheral disappear.
customer_reviews.author: D. Arnett

customer_reviews.title: great way to expand usb ports
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mac mini 2018, as it only has 2 USB ports of this type. it has been great, I love that it's usb 3.0, so it's fast, I've had no issues with devices such as my web cam, or with loading and deleting date from flash drives.
customer_reviews.author: atrou8

customer_reviews.title: <3 Anker
customer_reviews.text: bought this to use with an eGPU dock and a Thinkpad X230 to create a dockable laptop workstation that only needs three plugs inserted (Power, USB, Expresscard) and other than it power cycling the external graphics card when I unplug it (not hugely sure what causes this...??) it does the job very well! I love the big power button, subtly lit LEDs (I half expected it to light up my whole room), and super fast charging port. The fact it has 13 data usb ports is great too lol
customer_reviews.author: cole

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Anker hub. The first was a 9 port version and worked well but I began to require more ports, so I bought this 13 port version. Both hubs have worked flawlessly and have been very reliable. This one has an on/off switch at the front which can be useful sometimes if you want to disconnect all peripherals without actually pulling out wires. Overall my experience with products from this company has been very positive.
customer_reviews.author: Lights

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect this to work as a "USB power strip" in a drawer
customer_reviews.text: Don't do what Donny Don't does. This is a fine hub. It charges at high current when connected to a PC and with the power supply connected. Unfortunately, it won't charge anything when -not- connected to a PC (but still connected to its power supply), which was my use case. This behavior was not at all expected, but my fault for not doing better research.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pittelko

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Like it says on the tin - it's a USB hub with a charging port. It's been a rock-solid performer, vs the Insignia piece of junk I got at Best Buy. My only complaint is it holds the usb ports a little too snugly, which makes some things that I plug and unplug (such as a usb mic) a little strenuous. But i'd much rather have them secure than falling out. It's also a refreshingly solid piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dalrymple

customer_reviews.title: Anker makes great products including this one
customer_reviews.text: Anker makes great products including this one. We liked the 1st one we bought for my hubby's computer so much that we bought another for my computer. We also own their Soundcore wireless speaker and 2 chargers. I highly recommend this company and their products!
customer_reviews.author: L. Norris

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice looking hub
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice looking hub. I really like the aluminum, it gives it some weight so that the force of all those usb cables pulling to the side doesn't tip it over. It has some decent power but not enough to run more than 5 or 6 bus powered devices at once.
customer_reviews.author: W.

customer_reviews.title: nothing not to like after a month or so of use
customer_reviews.text: So far, nothing not to like after a month or so of use. Using five or six of the thirteen ports for printers, scanner and the occasional thumb drive with no issues. I don't currently use anything with particularly high throughput needs, but I think it would fare pretty well. Build quality is good, feels substantial without too much weight and the end single charging port works well with my iPhone4s. If you would like give it a bit of an anchor, a couple strips of double sided foam tape works well.
customer_reviews.author: fester

customer_reviews.title: Solved an array of weird component problems
customer_reviews.text: Apparently the lifespan of a USB hub is about 4 years. My prior one, 8 ports, started disconnecting my keyboard and unmounting a pair of new SSD drives. I figured that the $20 upcharge for 14 ports was worth it compared to 8 or 10 ports. I have 4 data ports open on this new hub, which replaced two others which were chained. All is good.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Windrum

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This hub is compact, USB 3.0 compatible, and accommodates all my USB devices. One of the 14 USB slots did not work. While the unit is compact, the power supply is big and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: CHL

customer_reviews.title: High capacity - Well made
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the number of things I have to plug into my computer seems to grow every year.This hub gives me plenty of connections, more than I actually need now. The power supply is beefy enough to supply power to those things that need it. There's also a USB charging outlet if you need one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McKeeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to put my tripod on dolly track
customer_reviews.text: I took the casters off my tripod dolly and put 3 sets of these wheels on and then got some 1.25" PVC pipes, connected them at each end with 24" pieces plus elbows and now I have a great, cheap dolly set up.
customer_reviews.author: GlennMS

customer_reviews.title: I am happy to report that so far I have had no ...
customer_reviews.text: With all the discussion about the interference caused at 2.4GHz by USB 3.0 hubs with both bluetooth and WiFi, I was hesitant to by any hub. I took a chance on this one because of the reviews extolling its sold construction. In particular, I hoped that the aluminum construction would provide some shielding. I am happy to report that so far I have had no discernible interference problems. For what is worth, here is my relevant computer equipment: 27" iMac 5K (Late 2015) Logitech K760 keyboard (bluetooth) Logitech MX Master mouse (bluetooth) Netgear R7900 Wifi Router Monoprice USB 3.0 cable from iMac to hub (rather than the supplied cable)
customer_reviews.author: Marc R Sontag

customer_reviews.title: Flexibility
customer_reviews.text: Finally a USB extension that I can really use. 14 ports! I don’t need that many but it helps. I’m consulating old hard drive data on to new drives and I need a lot of ports. There are as much as 5 old drives that all will go on one new drive.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Cow

customer_reviews.title: Ran VERY HOT, almost too hot to touch. ...
customer_reviews.text: Ran VERY HOT, almost too hot to touch. Was using it with 7 devices total attached to it. None of them were devices that needed power for charging just for communicating with peripherals. It would stop recognizing my mouse every couple of days then I plugged nay new 3D printer into it and the hub would randomly stop the communication to the printer. Very frustrating. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for iMac
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of gear. Seems well made and very solid. Plugged it in and it works. iMacs have limited USB ports and I have tons of USB devices and this looks like the perfect solution. I have to say that I was VERY impressed to receive an email from Anker asking if everything was ok and working. In this day and age that's pretty amazing. One of my reasons for buying this product is because a Belkin USB 3.0 hub failed and it took me 45 minutes on the phone to finally get a warranty replacement ordered. So it looks like Anker is really on top of customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Made Product
customer_reviews.text: This hub is well built. I like the fact that the tranformer is on a cord so I don't have to figure out how fit another wall wart into my UPS. The 13 ports is a nice plus too.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Great for plugging in lots of things through one USB 3.0 port.
customer_reviews.text: I have an absurd amount of things that I need to plug in to my laptop when using it at my desk with my monitor. Scanner, USB audio, Hard disks, a keyboard, a mouse, two printers... etc. This USB hub allows me to connect them all to my laptop with one plug, and turn the hub on and off with a convent button. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: Bought over 50 of these unit for a project. Great USB 3.0 hubs. My only complaint is that the little LED light covers fall through the aluminum housing if you press them, which will inevitably happen when you decide you want to pull a USB cable out of the port. Other than that, great build quality, reliable and quick connectivity. You can't ask for anything more... except maybe sturdier LED cover things.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Nieves

customer_reviews.title: but it performs beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: Can't control each usb with an on/off switch, but it performs beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: ramonals

customer_reviews.title: Best USB hub I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: 13 3.0 USB ports plus one power port. I have 10 items plugged in, all drawing power and this thing is humming along. Love that it has a power switch so I don't have to unhook everything. It's metal, solid and hopefully will last awhile. This is my third Anker product purchase and I'm happy with their stuff.
customer_reviews.author: DFB

customer_reviews.title: 4.8 Stars - USB port lights
customer_reviews.text: The number of stars is actually 4.8. The hub works great, high quality, except for one thing: the individual lights next to each USB jack do not blink when data is being read from or written to the device. The lights come on when devices are connected, but they stay lit solid no matter what the activity is on each port. Again, this is a minor issue, the operation of the hub otherwise is fine, I would buy from Anker again.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: caution
customer_reviews.text: this unit arrived less than a week ago, it has started to hum, buzz, beep intermittently, and heat up, not sure I would pay this much for something I feel like is going to burst best into flames... have not heard back from seller, but I will update after I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: This is the best USB 3.0 Hub!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Expanded my connectivity from a single USB 3.0 port on my laptop to 12 USB 3.0 ports. Connected both 3.0 devices, 2.0 devices, and digital cameras to this hub. No problems what so ever, and also got improved performance transferring and doing backup to my external hard drives. Couldn't be happier! Also has one port (#13) that can charge devices, like my Samsung Galaxy phone.
customer_reviews.author: kawika

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy This Again!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works as advertised. I really love Anker's products. I own a fair number of different Anker devices and they always perform well for me. Construction is great. Body feels solid, not cheap. Ports are a good fit, not too tight, not too loose. Power and throughput all good to great. Will order another soon.
customer_reviews.author: HouseAtreus

customer_reviews.title: Some bad things that kinda bothered me is the LED
customer_reviews.text: it's made by Anker + it does EXACTLY what it said... the entire unit feel premium, due to the aluminium construction. Some bad things that kinda bothered me are the LEDs... the brightness aren't consistent, some are brighter than other, but it doesn't matter to me because I would prefer none.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. TN

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iMac, charges iPad.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my iMac, and the charging port (the 14th slot) charges my iPad so I don't have to use one of the ports on the back of the computer or plug the iPad into the wall. I have two 2TB drives plugged into it and they work fine as well. It seems like there's never an end to the number of USB devices I need to plug into my Mac, and only this one is large enough (and capable enough) to always have a spare slot when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles McGuinness

customer_reviews.title: Great USB 3.0 hub
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Satisfied our need for additional USB 3.0 port perfectly..... Also took only minutes to installed..... nothing to do other than plug it in and use additional devices. BTW, I have 5 terabyte disk drives attached to this hub, no issues with data transfer at all.....
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice,
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, But not compatible with my Raspberry Pi computers as they only have USB 2.0 jacks.Will find another use on my Dell desktop which has a USB 3.0 jack now that I have the micro USB to USB adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: KI Time

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Anker USB 3.0 Aluminum 13-Port Hub
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the Anker USB 3.0 7-Port Hub and have been return to the manufacturer twice due to unreliabilable and the hub blue led go out and will not always identify the three Seagate hard drives. The Anker USB 3.0 Aluminum 13-Port Hub is an excellent products and so far is very reliabilable and can identify all my two Seagate hard drives and one Seagate Satellite Wi fi hard drive and the Pioneer 16X BDXL Blu Ray External Rewriteable Drive.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Really been appreciating Anker products - this is not the first of their products. They just seem to work, and be reasonably priced. One of the few electronic toys I have that I have to mess around with. I also have the little 6 port - great for my husband and I traveling!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Forster

customer_reviews.title: sleek and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Anker never fails to impress me. I was expecting a bulky, clunky item but the Hub was compact, sleek and very easy to use. It didn't require any complicated set-up. It also came in a beautiful packaging. Anker has that Apple flair but at a Microsoft price and their products work better than both! This is my second item from Anker and I am sold. I will definitely be buying more from them in the future,
customer_reviews.author: ZZ

customer_reviews.title: Great device.
customer_reviews.text: Product is made of good materials and has great speed for a usb hub. I use this for making usb drives for hand outs. I make them in two different locations. I make them at my office in Tennessee but I also travel to Singapore and the Philippines each year to do the same. We make about 200-400 over seas. This will help is over seas to create more materials.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of this USB hub sets it apart from others. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: great design, awesome build
customer_reviews.text: great design, awesome build, didn't get too hot when plugged in for an extended amount of time. 3 of the ports on mine were broken when it arrived, but they are were super understanding and fast with a refund
customer_reviews.author: Phil K.

customer_reviews.title: Will not solve USB 3.0 power drain with wireless keyboard/mouse configuration.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a super solid product, but I had to return mine for 2 reasons: 1) Port #10 was missing an LED lens/cover (just an empty hole). 2) Despite it's robust power supply, I was still unable to use my wireless keyboard and mouse when I plugged the unit into my PC, a problem that plagues my system with every USB 3.0 device I try to run in tandem with my wireless setup (some kind of power drain in the bus).
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Leavy

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product. I have purchased several other USB 3
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. I have purchased several other USB 3.0 hubs from other companies and they weren't even close to the quality of this one. From the performance all the way down to the way it is built, this is a solid product. I have also purchased several of their USB charging hubs for our various devices in different rooms of our home. None of them have let me down yet. I will continue to follow Anker and they will be my goto brand for these types of products.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Dyle

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best hub ever
customer_reviews.text: Far and away the best hub I've ever owned. Solidly built with sleek lines it looks and feels like the quality product that it is. I was surprised to see it not only power a Raspberry Pi, but it was also recognized by the Raspberry Pi. Right now I have it daisy chained onto an Anker 9 port (another awesome hub) and it's currently powering 9 USB Block Erupters. The tenth (an Antminer) wasn't recignized so it'll only handle 9. WELL worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: All the ports work great and the speed seems exceptional
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious USB hub. Since it's metal, it feels professional when you touch it. All the ports work great and the speed seems exceptional. Can't ask for much more than what this offers.
customer_reviews.author: CSherr

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for 2 weeks, and randomly today, my keyboard and mouse cut out intermittently. I could barely navigate to amazon to write this review, and I had to move my keyboard back to direct plug in to even fully type amazon.com out. Very displeased, usually give Anker products very high praise, but this one definitely falls short.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Great Experience
customer_reviews.text: What a lifesaver and space saver. 3 monitors, 3 external hard drives, DVD drive, and a bunch of other cable nightmares solved
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Anker Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had Anker products before and so far they have yet to disappoint. It does cost a little more but I prefer to pay for a quality product that works and works reliably. I own other Anker products and have yet to have any of them fail. Its simple, built well, and just works. You really don't even need to read the instructions its so simple. I hope they continue their tradition in building quality products such as these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P

customer_reviews.title: I find it not to be working well and as I have only ordered one it may be just that I got a bad one.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few issues with the Product, not the vendor. I find it not to be working well and as I have only ordered one it may be just that I got a bad one. I would like to state AnkerDirect is the Best ! They saw that I had an issue and sent me a replacement unit which is working great ! I would definitely order from them again because they actually care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Silhouett

customer_reviews.title: The additional dedicated charging port is awesome. Absolutely no problems with readability or connecting
customer_reviews.text: This hub is well made high grade aluminum. A rarity in our modern world of cheap plastic everything. 13 ports may seem excessive, but really is not when considering all of the usb based devices we have today. The additional dedicated charging port is awesome. Absolutely no problems with readability or connecting. Only one concern, it gets pretty warm.
customer_reviews.author: Prof

customer_reviews.title: best USB hub I've tested
customer_reviews.text: This is the first USB 3.0 hub that I've purchased that actually handles a reasonable amount of current source on each port. Maybe not spec 500mA, I haven't tested this, but it seems to have power to spare. It gets a little warm, I'm assuming the body (alum) is used to dissipate heat (heatsink). No resets due to overload, best USB hub I've tested. I own 3 now. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Cleland

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?!
customer_reviews.text: 13-ports, plus a charging-only port, compact and sturdy aluminum body, USB3, power indicators for each port. It's absolutely fabulous to be able to have all my external drives and devices hooked up to my laptop at the same time, then only have one cable to unplug when I take it on the road. Now, the most difficult problem is cable management to all those devices!
customer_reviews.author: D. Jordy

customer_reviews.title: The best high-capacity USB 3.0 data hub I have found.
customer_reviews.text: This USB 3.0 data hub has worked perfectly for me for over one year. It handles the available load of USB-connected devices without overheating or failing. I had tried other high-capacity USB data hubs, but none of them worked as well or as long as this unit has. I highly recommend this data hub to anyone with a large number of devices to connect at once; it works and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dechance

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and accessibility to drives
customer_reviews.text: I usually have couple of external hard disk drives and usb that i need to access from time to time. The Anker usb port has just solved that problem coz at the same i can access couple of drives now. Value for money
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Jacob

customer_reviews.title: I received this November 5th 2015. It is now ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this November 5th 2015. It is now completely unreliable. It's a constant challenge to understand why it works or doesn't work when it does. It drops connections to my hard drives for no apparent reason. I reconnect the drive, to have no response. Very frustrating, I was excited for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hector J. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent USB 3.0 Hub
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using it successfully for about a week. It is very substantially constructed—a quality product. Spacing of the ports is quite adequate. Little blue pilot lights on each port are a usefull feature. It is a nice extension to my CalDigit Thunderbolt hub. As is the circumstance with almost all computer devices, I wish there were a way to eliminate the obtrusive “power brick.”
customer_reviews.author: William Oglesby

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Can't really complain although I wouldn't have mind an extra port for smart charging. If you have iPod or iPhone, it will charge sufficiently on all ports. But iPad, especially the newer generations (4th and up), can only be charged on the Smart Charging Port. Nonetheless, this is a well-built usb hub. I had used several USB hubs before this one and all eventually failed or got short-circuited when put under pressure. This Ankler unit easily handles anything you throw at it and all usb devices work perfectly without any issues with all my computers.
customer_reviews.author: Eliyah Shin

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my system!
customer_reviews.text: This 13 port hub has all the bells and whistles, from USB 3 to charging port. Plenty of leds tell you what is going on, and an on off switch (sometimes quite helpful). It replaced three separate multi-hubs I was using, helped clear up wiring, power cords, etc. It worked perfectly straight out of the box. I you have a lot of USB peripherals, this is the best way to go IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Randy I

product_meta.title: Anker AH241 USB 3.0 Aluminum 13-Port Hub + 5V 2.1A Smart Charging Port with 12V 5A Power Adapter
product_meta.description:
An ideal speed solution for both data transfers and charging.

Superspeed X 13.
Don't deny your devices access to SuperSpeed ports. With transfer rates of up to 5Gbps, set aside less time for syncing and more time for work. (Note: actual rate will depend on the capability of your device.) With 13 data terminals to choose from, forget about ever having to switch or unplug again.

Full speed charge: every device, every time.
With an additional Smart Charging port, this hub was designed with compatibility in mind. The port will intelligently identify each connected device and speaks the language that allows it to accept a full speed charge – giving a superfast charge time for EVERY device (up to 2.1 Amps).

A mainstay for the future.
Featuring a high-grade chipset and durable adapter, this hub ensures a stable power supply while you work. The solid aluminum body ensures usage for years to come. Whether at home or in the office, add another can't-do-without fixture to your desk.

System requirements & Notes:
- Mac OS X Lion 10.7.4 users should upgrade to Mountain Lion 10.8.2 or later to avoid unstable connections.
- 2.4Ghz wireless devices (keyboards, mice, etc.) may not work around USB 3.0 ports. Try using a USB 2.0 connection.
- For maximum performance, connected devices should not exceed a combined current of 8A.
feature_bullets: Easily add 13 USB 3.0 ports to any compatible system. Save syncing time with data transfer rates of up to 5 Gbps (much faster than USB 2.0).
The Smart Charging Port enables full-speed charges (up to 2.1A) and universal charging compatibility.

Sturdy aluminum body withstands scratches and bumps. Built-in surge protector keeps your devices and data safe and supports hot swapping. External power supply ensures multiple devices work simultaneously.
Compatible with USB 2.0 and 1.1 specifications; no driver required for Windows XP/Vista/7/8/10 and Mac OS 10.2 and above.
Package contents: Anker USB 3.0 13-Port + 1 Smart Charging Port Aluminum Hub, USB 3.0 cable (2.6ft), 12V 5A power adapter (10ft), user manual. 18-month warranty, and free lifetime technical support.

specifications.Operating System: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 8, Windows 7, Mac OS X 10.2 Jaguar
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars522 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
